comments:

Do you have steps to reproduce ?

Of course, I forgot, but the steps are easy and 
will not really help you, I guess:

- double click the method name
- right click the name (for context menu)
- click refactor 
- click rename (popup occurs)
- enter new name
- click next (searching for references, checking preconditions

-> internal error (no context information available)

here is the signature:
class DateUtils {
  public static Timestamp convertDate(String date) {
...

I do not know the details, when it occurs.
If I copy the method, rename the copy to xxx and
try to refactor it the same way: no error occurs.
-> seems to be the references that makes it crash.

As I already reported in another bug:
when moving a method, the tool sometimes "forgets" references, 
in the same source-file where other references have been refactored.

There is another class that contains a similar method:
same name, different argument type and return type.
Perhaps the tool is confused by the different references?

There is another class that contains a very similar method:
same name, argument und return type, but different source code.

best regards

Thorsten van Ellen
The fix is in HEAD but not in 2.0.2. Do we consider to fix it?

I have 2.0.1, but I do not need it urgent!

best regards

Thorsten van Ellen

We don't have any plan to back port it for 2.0.2 since 2.02 is very close to be 
released.

Marked as fixed since bug is fixed in HEAD
